page.title: 17SHERIFF HUTTON VILLAGE HALL
page.content: The village hall stands in one corner of the playing field and was opened in 1984,the foundation stone having been laid the previous year by Prince Richard,Duke of Gloucester.The hall was built to replace the old memorial Hall,built in memory of those killed in the First World War.Some of its many uses are:playgroup,baby clinic, visiting doctors'consulting room, polling station,gardening club, Womens Institute,Parish Council,keep fit group,whist and bridge clubs, domino and bingo nights.There is a badminton club and court layout, also shower and changing facilities. The Art Group stage an exihibition of their work ever Easter,and in the summer there is the village produce show.The stage area opens off the main hall,there is a refreshment room, kichten,and small committee room.
